page.title: 01Durris Forest: NW Stonehaven
page.content: The block is comprised mostly of the FC plantation of Durris Forest on the 3 hills of Strathgyle (297m) Mundernal (315m) and the N slopes of Cairn-mon- Earn (378m). These latter 2 hills have unafforested summits of heathland although very young plantations (c.5 yrs) are found very high up on Mundernal Durris Forest has maturing trees (Pine, Larch and Sitka Spruce) some small sections have already been felled. Recreational usage of forest tracks eg walking, cross-country skiing, is increasing. The block also includes lower farmland to the W and N (mostly blocks 1,2,4,5 & 9). Small streams issuing from these hills and from others to the SW drain the farm- land, the biggest being the Sheeoch Burn which runs through squares 5,1 & 2, thence to the river Dee. There are scattered small farms in this strip.
